alert.note: Alert for Barnes; Cass; Ransom; Richland; Traill (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 10 at 7:22PM CST until March 10 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Forks has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Marshall County in northwestern Minnesota... Red Lake County in northwestern Minnesota... Northwestern Clay County in northwestern Minnesota... Norman County in northwestern Minnesota... Polk County in northwestern Minnesota... Northwestern Mahnomen County in northwestern Minnesota... Pennington County in northwestern Minnesota... Northeastern Ransom County in southeastern North Dakota... Cass County in southeastern North Dakota... Southeastern Traill County in southeastern North Dakota... Southeastern Barnes County in southeastern North Dakota... Northwestern Richland County in southeastern North Dakota... * Until 800 PM CST. * At 720 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Carpenters Corner to near Eldred to Hunter to Nome, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 50 and 101. Interstate 94 in North Dakota between mile markers 315 and 352. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 1 and 7. This snow squall will be near... Eldred around 725 PM CST. Carpenters Corner and Crookston around 730 PM CST. Grandin, Greenview and Alice around 735 PM CST. Harold, Gardner and Rosewood around 740 PM CST. Dakota Junction, Sheldon and Hendrum around 745 PM CST West Fargo, Fargo and Moorhead around 800 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this snow squall include Thief River Falls Airport, Casselton Airport, Moorhead Airport and West Argusville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
